thread.title: Reports: Sandra Bullock adopts second child, has boyfriend move in with her

author: Tyler White
title: Reports: Sandra Bullock adopts second child, has boyfriend move in with her

Image 21 of 21 Reports: Sandra Bullock adopts second child, has boyfriend move in with her 1 / 21 Back to Gallery Oscar-winning actress Sandra Bullock recently adopted a second child, a baby girl, just as her boyfriend moved in, according to celebrity news sites.
RadarOnline.com and The Daily Mail reported the 51-year-old actress from Virginia brought a new infant to her Los Angeles home, where boyfriend Bryan Randall is supposedly now a resident. Apparently the couple has been moving in the right direction, with Randall reported to be involved with caring for the new child.
“Sandra’s made it quite clear to Bryan from the start that she’s looking for a husband to raise kids with,” a source close to Bullock told RadarOnline.
RELATED: Sandra Bullock Named ‘World’s Most Beautiful Woman’
That source told RadarOnline Bullock has had paperwork ready for the adoption of the child, but wanted to make sure her boyfriend was committed to the idea.
RadarOnline’s story did not get confirmation or comment of the adoption through Bullock’s spokesperson.
Bullock’s recent films have been a voiceover role in “Minions” and a starring role in “Our Brand is Crisis,” both of which were released this year.
She opened a restaurant, Bess Bistro, in Austin in 2006, but the restaurant closed its doors for good this September after nine years of busines, according to Austin 360 . She also owns a bakery/flower shop, Walton's Fancy & Staples, in Austin, which opened in 2009.
Her popular film, "Miss Congeniality," had many scenes filmed in San Antonio, but most of the film was shot in Austin, according to IMDB .
